description: a(n) is smallest number which is uniquely a(j)+a(k), j<k.
comments: An Ulam-type sequence - see A002858 for many further references, comments, etc. - T. D. Noe, Jan 21 2008
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
S. R. Finch, Patterns in 1-additive sequences, Experimental Mathematics 1 (1992), 57-63.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ulam Sequence
prog: (Haskell)a003669 n = a003669_list !! (n-1)a003669_list = 3 : 4 : ulam 2 4 a003669_list-- Function ulam as defined in A002858.-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 03 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Mira Bernstein_
